如客戶需要更改通訊地址或確認現有通訊地址正確,可循以下途徑:
Please through below approaches to update / confirm correspondence address if need:
途徑1:透過「ePA申請通」為客戶更改通訊地址。
Approach 1: Update client correspondence address via ePA.
途徑2:保單持有人經myPrudential確認或更改通訊地址。
Approach 2: Policyowner can confirm / update correspondence address via myPrudential.
注意事項 Reminder:
1. 保單持有人必須確認或更改通訊地址才完成跟進手績。
Policyowner must confirm / update correspondence address to complete the follow-up action.
2. 退回信件可透過「myPrudential>電子通知書」或「AES>已遞交文件及副本」查閱。

results.title_name_en: How To Read A Renewal Policy Checklist & Reminder Email
results.title_name_tc: 如何解讀續保保單清單及提示電郵
results.content_en:
如何解讀續保保單清單及提示電郵
1. 續保保單清單每月發出,電郵題目為“GIEB Renewal 1st Reminder & Expired Policy List"
發出日期:每月第二個工作天
(A)表:列出本月內將要到期並已發出續保通知書的保單
(B)表:列出上月份和本月份已到期並已發出續保通知書的保單
例子:如電郵發出日期為5/5/2014,(A)表將會列出由5/5/2014至31/5/2014 到期的保單,而(B)表將會列出由1/4/2014 至 4/5/2014
已到期的保單(請注意:保單清單只包括以支票付款的一般保險的產品)
1
附有(*)的保單號碼將會於到期月最後一個工作天自動續保,惟有關保單以支票繳付保費,故此,提示電郵提醒您與客人聯絡,以
跟進支票付款事宜。
請注意:本續保保單清單只包括以支票付款的一般保險的產品

edule by the Insured and the Insured Person and anyone acting on his/
her behalf insofar as they relate to anything to be done or complied with by the

4
IMPORTANT - the Insured and the Insured Person are requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.III. Change of Occupation and Age Limit
This Polity shall cease to be in force if there is any change in the business or
occupation of the Insured Person unless the Company by endorsement declares
the Insurance to be continued. This Policy shall not be renewable after the Period
of Insurance in which the Insured Person reaches 76 years of age.
IV. Premium
If the payment method selected is either by autopay or by credit card premium of
this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated account in accordance
with the collection date as stated in the Schedule. Second attempt will be made
in the middle of the current month should the previous collection fails due to
insufficient fund only. For the avoidance of doubt the Company is not obliged to
make second attempt of collection if the previous collection fails for any other
reason.
If the payment method is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card the Insured
may request to change the nominated account from which premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form ("the
Form") to the Company 2 months before the expiry date of this Policy. Provided
that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed the Company will start
the premium collection from such new account on the collection date as stated on
the renewal documents.
If the payment method is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit card the
Insured may request to change the nominated account from which premium has
been collected by completing and returning the Form to the Company. Should
the payment method is monthly by autopay the Insured must return the Form
together with a cheque for the premium of the coming 2 months. Provided that
the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed the Company will resume
monthly premium collection from such new account on the third collection date
from the date on which such request is received.
The Company shall have the right to determine or change the collection date
of this Polity from time to time. The Company shall have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V. No Claim Bonus
In the event of no claim being made reported or arising under any Section of
this Polity during the preceding Period of Insurance upon anniversary date of this
Policy:
· A no claim bonus equivalent to 5% of the latest Sum Insured at the date of
renewal excluding any no claim bonus earned or transferred for Accidental
Death and Permanent Disablement will be granted in a form of increased Sum
Insured;
. In case the Sum Insured under Accidental Death and Permanent Disablement
is decreased upon the renewal any no claim bonus so earned previously will be
counted afresh based on the latest Sum Insured without counting any no claim
bonus so transferred from another insurance company.
The no claim bonus will be granted up to 5 consecutive renewals of this Policy
with the accumulated amount for each Insured Person subject to a maximum of
HK$500,000.
In the event of a single claim being made reported or arising under any Section
of this Policy after the no claim bonus has been earned the Sum Insured for
Accidental Death and Permanent Disablement shall be reduced upon renewal as if
no such bonus has ever been earned.
The no claim bonus earned is attached to this Policy and is not applicable to any
other Policy(ies) taken out by the Insured or the Insured Person. The no claim
bonus has to be earned afresh once the Policy has been lapsed.
If more than one Insured Person is covered under the Policy the no claim bonus
shall be applied as if a separate policy has been issued in respect of each of such
Insured Person.
VI. Transfer of No Claim Bonus
In the event of the Company has accepted the request of the Insured Person
to transfer the amount of no claim bonus as stated in the Schedule from his/
her personal accident insurance of another insurance company the benefits of
Accidental Death and Permanent Disablement will be increased by the same
amount.
In the event of a single claim being made reported or arising under any Section of
this Policy after the transfer of no claim bonus has been earned the Sum Insured
for Accidental Death and Permanent Disablement shall be reduced upon renewal
as if no such bonus has ever been transferred.
The no claim bonus transferred is attached to this Policy and is not applicable to
any other Policy(ies) taken out by the Insured or the Insured Person. The no claim
bonus previously transferred from another insurance company will not be given
again once the Policy has been lapsed.
If more than one Insured Person is covered under the Policy the transfer of no
claim bonus in respect of each of such Insured Person(s) shall be applied as if a
separate policy has been issued in respect of each of such Insured Person.
VII. Minimum Non-refundable Premium
For any one Period of Insurance this Policy is subject to a minimum premium of
HK$500 which is not refundable in any event once this Policy has been effected
when the refund is arising out of cancellation or any variation of the coverage of
this Policy.
VIII. Renewal
If the payment method selected is either by autopay or by credit card this Policy
will be renewed automatically on a yearly basis upon to successful premium
collection for its renewal unless written notice of cancellation has been received by
the Company before the corresponding collection date.
If the payment method is yearly either by autopay or by credit card premium for
the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of renewal
from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection date as
stated on the renewal documents.
If the payment method is monthly either by autopay or credit card premium for
the first month of the renewal will be collected on the collection date of the first
month of renewal from the Insured's nominated account automatically.
The Insured shall before any renewal of this Policy give notice to the Company of
any sickness or physical mental injury defect or infirmity of the Insured Person of
which the Insured has become aware during the preceding Period of Insurance
and of any change of name and address.
IX. Assignment
This Policy is not assignable and payment of any benefit under this Policy shall only
be made to the Insured Person or the legal personal representative of the Insured
Person whose receipt shall be a full and absolute discharge of the liability and
responsibility of the Company.
X. Claim Procedures
Claim Form must be given to the Company in respect of any death or Bodily
Injury which may give rise to a claim under this Policy with full particulars of both
the occurrence and the death and/ or Bodily Injury together with the following
supporting documents within 7 days in the case of death or within 30 days of the
occurrence of the Accident in the case of non-fatal Bodily Injury.
(a) Claims for Death
Death certificate letter of administration estate duty clearance letter and post-
mortem report.
(b) Claims for Permanent Disablement
Medical certificate issued by a Registered Medical Practitioner certifying the
diagnosis and the degree or the severity of disability and the cause of Bodily
Injury.
(c) Claims for Temporary Total Disablement
Medical certificate and original sick leave certificate with diagnosis issued by
a Registered Medical Practitioner copy of tax demand note and employer's
confirmation if the disablement period is more than 10 days.
(d) Claims for Temporary Partial Disablement
Medical certificate with diagnosis if the Insured Person is self-employed or
original sick leave certificate with diagnosis issued by a Registered Medical
Practitioner.
(e) Claims for Accidental Medical Expenses
Original medical expenses receipts with diagnosis issued by a Registered
Medical Practitioner and a Registered Medical Practitioners' referral letter when
specialists are consulted.
(f) Claims for Hospital Cash or Companion Bed
Original medical expenses receipts and medical certificate with diagnosis
issued by a Registered Medical Practitioner certifying the days of Hospital
Confinement and/ or companion bed.
The Insured Person shall furnish all such reports certificates and information in
addition to the above as may be reasonably required by the Company for the
purpose of ascertaining Polity liability.
All reports certificates and information required by the Company shall be furnished
at the Insured's expense and shall be in such form as the Company shall prescribe.
The Insured Person shall from time to time submit himself/ herself to medical
examination at the expense of the Company as may be required in connection
with any claim.
In case of death where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a
Registered Medical Practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed
to make a post-mortem examination of the body of the Insured Person at the
Company's expense.
Upon the payment of a valid claim under this Policy any unpaid premium of this
Policy may be deducted from such claim payment notwithstanding this Policy may
have been terminated.
XI. Cancellation
(a) The Company may cancel this Policy by sending 7 days' notice in writing by
a registered letter to the Insured at his last known address and in such event
the Insured shall be entitled to the return of a proportionate part of the paid
premium corresponding to the unexpired portion of the Period of Insurance
subject to (VII) Minimum Non-Refundable Premium above.
(b) The Insured may cancel this Policy by giving the Company 7 days' notice in
writing. In such case the Company will retain the customary short period rate
for the time this Policy has been in force and refund the balance of premium
to the Insured provided that no claim has been made during the current Period
of Insurance and subject to (VII) Minimum Non-Refundable Premium above.
(c) If the payment method is monthly either by autopay or by credit card the
Company shall be entitled to cancel this Policy effective from the first date
of the period for which premium is not paid and the Insured shall not be
entitled to the return of the collected premium under this circumstance
notwithstanding 11 (a) and 11 (b) above.
(d) In the event that premium for the first month of this Polity is not paid this
Policy shall be deemed to have been void from the first date of Period of
Insurance as described in the Schedule.
(e) Should the payment be made in monthly either by autopay or by credit card
and premium for one or more months has been paid non-payment of premium
for subsequent month(s) shall render this Policy terminated automatically from
the first date of the unpaid period.
XII. Jurisdiction
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong
Kong Court.
XIII. Arbitration
Any dispute, controversy, difference or claim arising out of or relating to this
Policy, including the existence, validity, interpretation, performance, breach or
termination thereof or any dispute regarding non-contractual obligations arising
out of or relating to it shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration
administered by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC) under
the HKIAC Administered Arbitration Rules in force when the Notice of Arbitration
is submitted. The law of this arbitration clause shall be Hong Kong law. The seat
of arbitration shall be Hong Kong. The number of arbitrators shall be one. The
arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English. If the Company shall
disclaim liability to the Insured for any claim under this Policy and such claim
shall not within twelve calendar months from the date of such disclaimer have
IMPORTANT - the Insured and the Insured Person are requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.

results.content_en:
of Insurance, together
with a variation form signed by the Policyholder(s), are received by us within
the Policy Review Period and (ii) have not filed any claims under the Policy.
6. Payment of Premium
i.
If the payment method selected is by credit card, the premium of
this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated account
6
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.in accordance with the collection date as stated in the Certificate of
Insurance. A second attempt will be made in the middle of the current
month should the previous collection fail due to insufficient funds only.
ii.
If the payment mode is yearly by credit card, the Insured may request
to change the nominated account from which the premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment
Form to the Company. Provided that the setup of the new nominated
account is confirmed, the Company will start premium collection from
the account on the next collection date. The Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company 10
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by credit card, the Insured may request
to change the nominated account from which the premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment
Form to the Company. Provided that the setup of the new nominated
account is confirmed, the Company will start monthly premium collection
on the next collection date from the date upon which such request
is received. The Insured must return the completed Payment Details
Amendment Form to the Company 10 working days before the use of
the new payment method. Change of payment mode is not allowed
during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of this
Policy without prior notice and also have the right to revise and determine
the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full 12 months' Period of Insurance from
the Effective Date regardless whether the yearly or monthly payment
mode is selected. Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium
is paid up to date at the time the claim is payable by the Company and
the Insured is not allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the
Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7. No Claim Premium Refund
i.
In the event of no claim being made, submitted, reported or arising
under any Section of the Policy for a period of 3 full consecutive policy
years, the Company shall refund to the Insured 15% of premium received
during the 3 policy years after the end of that 3-year period. Provided
that the Policy is renewed in next policy year after that 3-year period.
ii.
If no claim being made, submitted, reported or arising under any Section
of the Policy for a further period of 3 full consecutive policy years from
the previous No Claim Premium Refund, the Company shall refund 15%
of premium received for the said further 3-year period. Provided that the
Policy is renewed in next policy year after that 3-year period.
iii. If any claim being made, submitted, reported or arising under any Section
of the Policy, the 3-year period shall count afresh from the next policy
year after the first date of hospitalisation resulting in the said claim.
iv.
In case the Policy is terminated before the end of a period of 3 full
consecutive policy years, no pro rata refund will be allowed.
V.
If more than one Insured Person is covered under the Policy, any No
Claim Premium Refund shall be applied as if a separate policy has been
issued in respect of each Insured Person.
8. Renewal and Variation
i. The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this
Policy that the Company deems to be material, but any accidental omission
of failure to notify the Insured shall not invalidate such alteration.
ii. The Policy shall be effective for a period of one (1) year and shall be
guaranteed to be renewable annually subject to the Table of Benefits,
the Table of Premium, the Schedule of Surgical Operations, the terms
and conditions of this Policy, and Additions/ Amendments to this Policy
being in force at the time of renewal. Section I is renewable up to age
100. Section II is life-long renewable.
iii.
The Company will renew this Policy automatically on a yearly basis,
subject to the Table of Benefits, the Table of Premium, the Schedule
of Surgical Operations, the terms and conditions of this Policy, and
Additions/ Amendments to this Policy being in force at the time of
renewal, upon successful premium collection for such renewal unless a
designated variation form for policy termination has been received by
the Company 10 days before the Effective Date of the renewal.
iv. If the payment mode is yearly by credit card, the renewal premium of
the coming year shall be collected from the Insured's nominated account
automatically on the collection date as stated in the renewal documents.
If the payment mode is monthly by credit card, renewal premium will be
collected monthly from the Insured's nominated account automatically
on the collection date as stated in the renewal documents.
V.
Except for the changing of the nominated account from which premium
has been collected as mentioned in 5(ii) and (iii) above, the Insured may
apply for other variations by completing the Variation Form within one
(1) month before the Effective Date of renewal for the approval of the
Company. The Insured may also apply for the addition of Section II by
completing the Variation Form.
vi. Acceptance of any higher level of cover shall not apply to any conditions
or complaints existing at the time of the Company's acceptance for which
there was then a foreseeable need for Treatment or for consultation
with any medical practitioner unless such foreseeable need was fully
disclosed to the Company at the time of application and accepted by
the Company.
vii. The Company shall have the right to alter the Table of Benefits (including
the Table of Premium) or the terms and conditions of this Policy from
time to time. This Policy shall not be subject to any such alterations until
the next renewal of this Policy.
9.
Termination
In case of non-payment of premium, the Company shall have the right to
terminate this Policy by sending a written termination notice to the Insured
at his/her last known address; such termination of this Policy shall become
effective on the first date when the premium is not received by the Company.
10. Currency
i.
Both premium and claims of this Policy shall be made in Hong Kong
dollars.
ii.
Any claim under this Policy made by the Insured in currency other than
Hong Kong dollars shall be converted to Hong Kong dollars at the official
buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in Hong
Kong at the date of the clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.
11. Submission of Claims
i.
The Insured Person shall first claim against his/her Group Medical Insurance/
Personal Medical Insurance (if any) before submitting the claim to the
Company. The benefits of this policy are deemed as secondary insurance.
The Company will only cover the amount of eligible medical expenses not
reimbursed by Group Medical Insurance or Personal Medical Insurance.
ii.
The medical report as reasonably required by the Company shall be
furnished at the expense of the Insured. The Company shall have the
right to medically examine any Insured Person in respect of the submitted
claim and shall also have the right to require an autopsy in case of death
of any Insured Person where it is not forbidden by law.
iii. Any payments made in any circumstances for which this Policy do not
provide shall in all cases be at the Company's sole discretion.
iv.
If any claim made shall be fraudulent or exaggerated, the Company shall
have the right to terminate this Policy and the Insured and the Insured
Person shall repay to the Company all indemnity and benefits paid by
the Company in respect of such fraudulent or exaggerated claim. The
Company shall have the right to recover from the Insured and the Insured
Person any cost in relation to such termination and such fraudulent or
exaggerated claim.
v.
Any claims payments will be made to the bank account as designated
by the Insured at the time of application of this Policy, or by a cheque
payable to the Insured if a bank account is not designated at the time
of application.
vi.
The Insured must report to the Company in writing in case of the loss
of claims cheque. A handling fee of HK$100 shall be charged for each
cheque reissuance.
vii. No reimbursement of claims shall be made for claim(s) submitted after
90 days from the date of the expenditure being incurred or insufficiency
of required information.
12. Jurisdiction
The Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
Hong Kong courts.
13. Assignment
This Policy shall not be assignable and payment of any indemnity and benefit
by the Company under this Policy shall only be made to the Insured or his/
her legal personal representatives whose receipt of such indemnity and
benefit from the Company via cheque or by autopay through the Insured's
nominated bank account number for claim reimbursement, shall be a full
discharge of the Company's obligation toward the Insured and the Insured
Person in respect of such claim.
14. Arbitration
Any dispute, controversy, difference or claim arising out of or relating to this
Policy, including the existence, validity, interpretation, performance, breach
or termination thereof or any dispute regarding non-contractual obligations
arising out of or relating to it shall be referred to and finally resolved by
arbitration administered by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre
(HKIAC) under the HKIAC Administered Arbitration Rules in force when the
Notice of Arbitration is submitted. The law of this arbitration clause shall be
Hong Kong law. The seat of arbitration shall be Hong Kong. The number of
arbitrators shall be one. The arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in
English. If the Company shall disclaim liability to the Insured for any claim
under this Policy and such claim shall not within twelve calendar months from
the date of such disclaimer have been referred to arbitration in accordance
with this arbitration clause, then the claim shall for all purposes be deemed
to have been abandoned and shall not thereafter be recoverable.
15. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under
the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of
Hong Kong) to enforce any of the terms of this policy.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.

i.

Insurance. A second attempt will be made in the middle of the current
month should the previous collection fail due to insufficient funds only.
ii.
If the payment mode is yearly by credit card, the Insured may request
to change the nominated account from which the premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment
Form to the Company. Provided that the setup of the new nominated
account is confirmed, the Company will start premium collection from
the account on the next collection date. The Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company 10
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by credit card, the Insured may request
to change the nominated account from which the premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment
Form to the Company. Provided that the setup of the new nominated
account is confirmed, the Company will start monthly premium collection
on the next collection date from the date upon which such request
is received. The Insured must return the completed Payment Details
Amendment Form to the Company 10 working days before the use of
the new payment method. Change of payment mode is not allowed
during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of this
Policy without prior notice and also have the right to revise and determine
the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full 12 months' Period of Insurance from
the Effective Date regardless whether the yearly or monthly payment
mode is selected. Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium
is paid up to date at the time the claim is payable by the Company and
the Insured is not allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the
Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7. No Claim Premium Refund
i.
In the event of no claim being made, submitted, reported or arising
under any Section of the Policy for a period of 3 full consecutive policy
years, the Company shall refund to the Insured 15% of premium received
during the 3 policy years after the end of that 3-year period. Provided
that the Policy is renewed in next policy year after that 3-year period.
ii.
If no claim being made, submitted, reported or arising under any Section
of the Policy for a further period of 3 full consecutive policy years from
the previous No Claim Premium Refund, the Company shall refund 15%
of premium received for the said further 3-year period. Provided that the
Policy is renewed in next policy year after that 3-year period.
iii. If any claim being made, submitted, reported or arising under any Section
of the Policy, the 3-year period shall count afresh from the next policy
year after the first date of hospitalisation resulting in the said claim.
iv.
In case the Policy is terminated before the end of a period of 3 full
consecutive policy years, no pro rata refund will be allowed.
V.
If more than one Insured Person is covered under the Policy, any No
Claim Premium Refund shall be applied as if a separate policy has been
issued in respect of each Insured Person.

i. The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this

being in force at the time of renewal. Section I is renewable up to age
100. Section II is life-long renewable.

subject to the Table of Benefits, the Table of Premium, the Schedule

Additions/ Amendments to this Policy being in force at the time of

automatically on the collection date as stated in the renewal documents.

collected monthly from the Insured's nominated account automatically
on the collection date as stated in the renewal documents.

ii.

buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in Hong
Kong at the date of the clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.

IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.· certification is received from the Registered Medical Practitioner performing
the relevant blood transfusion and from the legally constituted blood or blood
product supplier in Hong Kong which supplied the particular blood or blood
product for the relevant transfusion confirming that the Insured Person is
infected by HIV or AIDS through blood transfusion.
"Aplastic Anaemia"
Bone marrow failure which results in anaemia neutropenia and thrombocytopenia
requiring treatment with at least one of the followings:
· blood product transfusion
· marrow stimulating agents
· immunosuppressive agents
· bone marrow transplantation
"Elephantiasis"
The result and complication of filariasi characterised by massive swelling in the
tissues of the body as a result of obstructed circulation in lymphatic vessels.
Unequivocal diagnosis of elephantiasis must be clinically confirmed by an
appropriate specialist including laboratory confirmation of microfilariae and must
be supported by our Registered Medical Practitioner.
The benefit does not cover Lymphoedema caused by infection with a sexually
transmitted disease trauma postoperative scarring congestive heart failure or
congenital lymphatic system abnormalities.
"Occupationally Acquired HIV"
Infection with HIV where it was acquired as a result of an accident during the
course of carrying out normal occupational duties with sero-conversion to Positive
HIV antibody occurring within 6 months of the accident. Any accident giving
rise to a potential claim must be reported to the Company within 30 days of the
incident and be supported by a negative HIV antibody test taken immediately
after the incident. This coverage shall cease in the event of an efficient and
effective vaccine being found for the prevention of HIV/AIDS.
The benefit does not cover sexually transmitted HIV infection.
"Severe Rheumatoid Arthritis"
Widespread joint destruction with major clinical deformity of 3 or more of the
following joint areas: hands wrists elbows spine knees ankles feet. The diagnosis
must be supported by all of the following:
· morning stiffness
· symmetric arthritis
· presence of rheumatoid nodules
· elevated titres of rheumatoid factors
· radiographic evidence of severe involvement
The diagnosis must be confirmed by a Consultant Rheumatologist.
"Terminal Illness"
In the opinion of the medical specialist involved and subject to the acceptance of
our appointed Registered Medical Practitioner the advent of death is highly likely
within 12 months.

IMPORTANT - the Insured and the Insured Person are requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction."Student"
Shall mean aged below 18 and unmarried full-time student.
"Sum Insured"
Shall mean the sum insured stated in the Schedule subject to the terms and
conditions of this Policy.
"Total Permanent Disablement"
Shall mean absolute total disablement for continuous twelve calendar months
and at the end of that time being beyond hope of improvement. The relevant
disablement must be certified by a Registered Medical Practitioner supported by
medical reports and full diagnosis.
“The Company"
Shall mean Prudential General Insurance Hong Kong Limited.
GENERAL CONDITIONS
I. Interpretation
This Policy and the Schedule shall be read together as one contract and any
word or expression to which a specific meaning has been attached in any part of
this Policy or of the Schedule shall bear such meaning wherever it may appear.
II. Observance
The due observance and fulfillment of all the terms and conditions of this Polity
and Schedule by the Insured and the Insured Person and anyone acting on his/
her behalf insofar as they relate to anything to be done or complied with by the
Insured and the Insured Person and anyone acting on his/her behalf shall be a
condition precedent to any liability of the Company to make any payment under
this Policy.
III. Age Limit
This Policy shall not be renewable after the Period of Insurance in which the
Insured Person reaches 76 years of age.
IV. Premium
If the payment method selected is either by autopay or credit card premium
of this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated account in
accordance with the collection date as stated in the Schedule. Second attempt
will be made in the middle of the current month should the previous collection
fails due to insufficient fund only. For the avoidance of doubt the Company is not
obliged to make second attempt of collection if the previous collection fails for
any other reason.
If the payment method is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card the Insured
may request to change the nominated account from which premium has been
collected by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form "the
Form" to the Company 2 months before the expiry date of this Policy. Provided
that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed the Company will
start the premium collection from such new account on the collection date as
stated on the renewal documents.
If the payment method is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit card the
Insured may request to change the nominated account from which premium has
been collected by completing and returning the Form to the Company. Should
the payment method is monthly by autopay the Insured must return the Form
together with a cheque for the premium of the coining 2 months. Provided that
the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed the Company will resume
monthly premium collection from such new account on the third collection date
from the date on which such request is received.
The Company shall have the right to determine or change the collection date
of this Policy from time to time. The Company shall have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V. No Claim Premium Refund
In the event of no claim being made reported or arising under any Section of the
Policy for a period of 3 full consecutive policy years the Company shall refund to
the Insured 20% of premium received during the 3 policy years after the end of
that 3-year period.
If no claim being made reported or arising under any Section of the Policy for
a further period of 3 full consecutive policy years from the previous No Claim
Premium Refund the Company shall refund 20% of premium received for the
said further 3-year period.
If any claim being made reported or arising under any Section of the Policy
the 3-year period shall count afresh from the next polity year after the date of
occurrence of the Bodily Injury resulting in the said claim.
In case the Policy is terminated before the end of a period of 3 full consecutive
policy years no pro-rata refund will be allowed.
If more than one Insured Person is covered under the Policy No Claim Premium
Refund shall be applied as if a separate polity has been issued in respect of each
of such Insured Person.
VI. Minimum Non-Refundable Premium
For any one Period of Insurance this Policy is subject to a minimum premium of
HK$500 which is not refundable in any event once this Polity has been effected
when the refund is arising out of cancellation or any variation of the coverage of
this Policy.
VII. Renewal
If the payment method selected is either by autopay or credit card this Policy
will be renewed automatically on a yearly basis upon to successful premium
collection for its renewal unless written notice of cancellation has been received
by the Company before the corresponding collection date.
If the payment method is yearly either by autopay or by credit card premium
for the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of
renewal from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection
date as stated on the renewal document.
If the payment method is monthly either by autopay or credit card premium for
the first month of the renewal will be collected on the collection date of the first
month of renewal from the Insured's nominated account automatically.
The Insured shall before any renewal of this Policy give notice to the Company of
any sickness or physical mental injury defect or infirmity of the Insured Person of
which the Insured has become aware during the preceding Period of Insurance
and of any change of name and address.
VIII.Assignment
This Policy is not assignable and payment of any benefit under this Policy shall
only be made to the Insured Person or the legal personal representative of the
Insured Person whose receipt shall be a full and absolute discharge of the liability
and responsibility of the Company.
IX. Claim Procedures
Claim Form must be given to the Company in respect of any death or Bodily
Injury which may give rise to a claim under this Policy with full particulars of both
the occurrence and the death and/ or Bodily Injury together with the following
supporting documents within 7 days in the case of death or within 30 days of
the occurrence of the Accident in the case of non-fatal Bodily Injury.
(i) Claims for Death
Death certificate letter of administration estate duty clearance letter and
post-mortem report.
Proof of the occurrence of Accident happens when the Insured Person is
participating in cycling or hiking or marathon if applicable.
(ii) Claims for Permanent Disablement
Medical certificate issued by a Registered Medical Practitioner certifying the
diagnosis and the degree or the severity of disability and the cause of Bodily
Injury.
Proof of the occurrence of Accident happens when the Insured Person is
participating in cycling or hiking or marathon if applicable.
Proof of the occurrence of Accident happens when the Insured Person is
within School area or participating in the activity officially organized by the
School and the proof of the Insured Person as a registered Student of the
School if applicable.
(iii) Claims for Accidental Medical Expenses
Original medical expenses receipts with diagnosis issued by a Registered
Medical Practitioner and a Registered Medical Practitioners' referral letter
when specialists are consulted.
Medical certificate with diagnosis and cause of Bodily Injury and/ or proof of
the occurrence of Accident happens when the Insured Person is participating
in cycling or hiking or marathon overseas if applicable.
(iv) Claims for Hospital Cash or Companion Bed
Original medical expenses receipts and medical certificate with diagnosis
issued by a Registered Medical Practitioner certifying the days of Hospital
Confinement and/ or companion bed.
(v) Claims for Educational Expenses
Original receipts of Student Service Vehicle School Fee and the course or
activity officially organized by Educational Institution issued by the relevant
organization or Educational Institution and the proof of the Insured
Person as a registered Student or member of the Educational Institution if
applicable.
The Insured Person shall furnish all such reports certificates and information in
addition to the above as may be reasonably required by the Company for the
purpose of ascertaining Polity liability.
All reports certificates and information required by the Company shall be
furnished at the Insured's expense and shall be in such form as the Company
shall prescribe.
The Insured Person shall from time to time submit himself/ herself to medical
examination at the expense of the Company as may be required in connection
with any claim.
In case of death where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a
Registered Medical Practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed
to make a post-mortem examination of the body of the Insured Person at the
Company's expense.
Upon the payment of a valid claim under this Policy any unpaid premium of this
Policy may be deducted from such claim payment notwithstanding this Policy
may have been terminated.
X. Cancellation
(i) The Company may cancel this Policy by sending 7 days' notice in writing by
a registered letter to the Insured at his last known address and in such event
the Insured shall be entitled to the return of a proportionate part of the paid
premium corresponding to the unexpired portion of the Period of Insurance
subject to (6) Minimum Non-Refundable Premium above.
(ii) The Insured may cancel this Polity by giving the Company 7 days' notice in
writing. In such case the Company will retain the customary short period rate
for the time this Policy has been in force and refund the balance of premium
to the Insured provided that no claim has been made during the current
Period of Insurance and subject to (6) Minimum Non- Refundable Premium
above.
(iii) If the payment method is monthly either by autopay or by credit card the
Company shall be entitled to cancel this Policy effective from the first date
of the period for which premium is not paid and the Insured shall not be
entitled to the return of the collected premium under this circumstance,
notwithstanding 10(i) and 10(ii) above.
(iv) In the event that premium for the first month of this Polity is not paid this
Policy shall be deemed to have been void from the first date of Period of
Insurance as described in the Schedule.
(v) Should the payment be made in monthly either by autopay or by credit
card and premium for one or more months has been paid non-payment
of premium for subsequent month(s) shall render this Polity terminated
automatically from the first date of the unpaid period.
XI. Jurisdiction
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong
Kong Court.
IMPORTANT - the Insured and the Insured Person are requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.

results.content_en:
and
exceptions of Section I shall automatically apply to the optional plans
but not vice versa.
v.
Under no circumstances shall the optional plans be accepted again once
the previous optional plans have been terminated for whatever reason.
5. Policy Review Period
In case the Insured is not completely satisfied, the Insured is allowed to
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.cancel this Policy within the Policy Review Period, which is thirty (30) days
from the Effective Date of the Policy. Any Premium paid will be refunded to
you, provided that: (i) the Policy and the Certificate of Insurance, together
with a variation form signed by the Policyholder(s), are received by us within
the Policy Review Period and (ii) have not filed any claims under the Policy.
6. Payment of Premium
i. If the payment method selected is either via autopay or credit card, the
premium for this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated
account in accordance with the collection date as stated in the Certificate
of Insurance. A second attempt will be made in the middle of the current
month should the previous collection fail due to insufficient funds.
ii.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card, the
Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank account or
credit card account from which premium has been collected by completing
and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company.
Provided that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed, the
Company will start the premium collection from the account on the next
collection date. Should the payment method be by autopay the Insured
must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the
Company two (2) months before the use of the new payment method.
If the payment method is by credit card, the Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company ten (10)
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit
card, the Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank
account or credit card account from which premium has been collected
by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company. Should the payment method be monthly by autopay the
Insured must return the Form together with a cheque for the premium
for the coming two (2) months. Provided that the setup of the new
nominated account is confirmed, the Company will resume monthly
premium collection on the third collection date from the date on which
such request is received. If the payment method is by credit card, the
Insured must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company ten (10) working days before the use of the new payment
method. Change of payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of
this Policy without prior notice, as well as have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full twelve (12) months' Period of Insurance
from the Effective Date regardless of yearly or monthly payment mode.
Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium is paid up to date
at the time the claim is payable by the Company and the Insured is not
allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7.
Renewal and Variation
i.
The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this
Policy that the Company deems to be material, but any accidental omission
or failure to notify the Insured shall not invalidate such alteration.
ii.
The Policy shall be effective for a period of one (1) year and shall be
guaranteed to be renewed annually (regardless of age of the Insured
Person) for Section I whilst the Policy shall be guaranteed to be renewed
annually for Section II the Optional Medical Plus Plan up to age 100
and for Section III the Optional Hospital Cash Plan shall be guaranteed
to be renewed annually up to age 74, subject to the Table of Benefits,
the Table of Premium, the Schedule of Surgical Operations, and the
Additions/ Amendments to this Policy that generally are in force at the
renewal date.
iii. The Company will renew this Policy automatically on a yearly basis upon
successful premium collection for such renewal, unless a designated
PRUChoice Medical-Variation Form for policy termination has been
received by the Company ten (10) days before the Effective Date of
the renewal.
iv.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card renewal,
the premium for the coming year shall be collected from the Insured's
nominated account automatically on the collection date as stated in
the renewal documents. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or
monthly by credit card renewal, the premium will be collected monthly
from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection
date as stated in the renewal documents.
V.
Except for changing the nominated account from which premium has
been collected as mentioned in 5(ii) and (iii) above, the Insured may
apply for other variations by completing the Variation Form within one
(1) month before the Effective Date of renewal for the approval of the
Company.
vi. Acceptance of any higher level of cover shall not apply to any conditions
or complaints existing at the time of the Company's acceptance for which
there was then a foreseeable need for Treatment or for consultation
with any medical practitioner, unless such foreseeable need was fully
disclosed to the Company at the time of application and accepted by
the Company.
vii. The Company shall have the right to alter the Table of Benefits (including
the Table of Premium) and the terms and conditions of this Policy from
time to time. This Policy shall not be subject to any such alternations
until the next renewal of this Policy.
viii. The Company has the right to adjust premium rates on a community
pool basis because of several factors, including the Company's claims
and persistency experience.
8.
Termination
In case of non-payment of premium, the Company shall have the right to
terminate this Policy by sending a written termination notice to the Insured
at his/ her last known address; such termination of this Policy shall become
effective on the first date when premium is not received by the Company.
9.
Currency
i.
Both premium and claims of this Policy shall be made in Hong Kong
dollars.
ii.
Any claim under this Policy made by the Insured in a currency other
than Hong Kong dollars shall be converted to Hong Kong dollars at the
official buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in
Hong Kong at the date of clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.
10. Claims
i.
Any medical report as reasonably required by the Company shall be
furnished at the expense of the Insured. The Company shall have the
right to medically examine any Insured Person in respect of the submitted
claim and shall also have the right to require an autopsy in case of the
death of any Insured Person where it is not forbidden by law.
ii.
Any claim payments made in any circumstances for which this Policy
does not provide shall in all cases be at the Company's sole discretion.
iii.
If any claim made shall be found to be fraudulent or exaggerated, the
Company shall have the right to terminate this Policy and the Insured
and the Insured Person shall repay to the Company all indemnity and
benefits paid by the Company in respect of such fraudulent or exaggerated
claims. The Company shall have the right to recover from the Insured
and the Insured Person any costs in relation to such termination and
such fraudulent or exaggerated claims.
iv.
Any claim payments will be made to the bank account as designated
by the Insured at the time of application of this policy, or by a cheque
payable to the Insured should the bank account not be designated at
the time of such application.
V.
The Insured must report to the Company in writing in case of the loss
of a daims cheque. A handling fee of HK$100 shall be charged for each
cheque reissuance.
vi.
No reimbursement of claims shall be made for claim(s) submitted after
ninety (90) days from the date of the expenditure being incurred or
insufficiency of required information.
11. Jurisdiction
The Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
Hong Kong courts.
12. Assignment
This Policy shall not be assignable and payment of any indemnity and benefits
by the Company under this Policy shall only be made to the Insured or his/
her legal personal representatives whose receipt of such indemnity and
benefits from the Company via cheque or by autopay through the Insured's
nominated bank account number for claim reimbursement, shall be a full
discharge of the Company's obligation towards the Insured and the Insured
Person in respect of such claim.
13. Arbitration
All differences, disputes or claims arising out of this Policy shall be referred
to the decision of an arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the parties in
difference or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator, to the decision
of two arbitrators one to be appointed by each of the parties in writing or,
in case the arbitrators do not agree with each other an umpire appointed
by the arbitrators in writing will make a decision. The making of the award
shall be a condition precedent to any liability of the Company or any right of
action against the Company in respect of any claim. The seat of arbitration
shall be in Hong Kong.
14. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under
the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of
Hong Kong) to enforce any terms of this Policy.
15. Prevailing Provision
The terms and conditions of this Insurance are set out in both English and
Chinese. In the event that conflicts or inconsistence arise between the English
and Chinese versions, the English version shall prevail.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.

Provided that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed, the
Company will start the premium collection from the account on the next
collection date. Should the payment method be by autopay the Insured
must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the
Company two (2) months before the use of the new payment method.
If the payment method is by credit card, the Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company ten (10)
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit
card, the Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank
account or credit card account from which premium has been collected
by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company. Should the payment method be monthly by autopay the
Insured must return the Form together with a cheque for the premium
for the coming two (2) months. Provided that the setup of the new
nominated account is confirmed, the Company will resume monthly
premium collection on the third collection date from the date on which
such request is received. If the payment method is by credit card, the
Insured must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company ten (10) working days before the use of the new payment
method. Change of payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of
this Policy without prior notice, as well as have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full twelve (12) months' Period of Insurance
from the Effective Date regardless of yearly or monthly payment mode.
Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium is paid up to date
at the time the claim is payable by the Company and the Insured is not
allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7.
Renewal and Variation
i.
The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this
Policy that the Company deems to be material, but any accidental omission
or failure to notify the Insured shall not invalidate such alteration.
ii.
The Policy shall be effective for a period of one (1) year and shall be
guaranteed to be renewed annually (regardless of age of the Insured
Person) for Section I whilst the Policy shall be guaranteed to be renewed
annually for Section II the Optional Medical Plus Plan up to age 100
and for Section III the Optional Hospital Cash Plan shall be guaranteed
to be renewed annually up to age 74, subject to the Table of Benefits,
the Table of Premium, the Schedule of Surgical Operations, and the
Additions/ Amendments to this Policy that generally are in force at the
renewal date.
iii. The Company will renew this Policy automatically on a yearly basis upon
successful premium collection for such renewal, unless a designated
PRUChoice Medical-Variation Form for policy termination has been
received by the Company ten (10) days before the Effective Date of
the renewal.
iv.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card renewal,
the premium for the coming year shall be collected from the Insured's
nominated account automatically on the collection date as stated in
the renewal documents. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or
monthly by credit card renewal, the premium will be collected monthly
from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection
date as stated in the renewal documents.
V.
Except for changing the nominated account from which premium has
been collected as mentioned in 5(ii) and (iii) above, the Insured may
apply for other variations by completing the Variation Form within one
(1) month before the Effective Date of renewal for the approval of the
Company.
vi. Acceptance of any higher level of cover shall not apply to any conditions
or complaints existing at the time of the Company's acceptance for which
there was then a foreseeable need for Treatment or for consultation
with any medical practitioner, unless such foreseeable need was fully
disclosed to the Company at the time of application and accepted by
the Company.
vii. The Company shall have the right to alter the Table of Benefits (including
the Table of Premium) and the terms and conditions of this Policy from
time to time. This Policy shall not be subject to any such alternations
until the next renewal of this Policy.
viii. The Company has the right to adjust premium rates on a community
pool basis because of several factors, including the Company's claims
and persistency experience.
8.
Termination
In case of non-payment of premium, the Company shall have the right to
terminate this Policy by sending a written termination notice to the Insured
at his/ her last known address; such termination of this Policy shall become
effective on the first date when premium is not received by the Company.
9.
Currency
i.
Both premium and claims of this Policy shall be made in Hong Kong
dollars.
ii.
Any claim under this Policy made by the Insured in a currency other
than Hong Kong dollars shall be converted to Hong Kong dollars at the
official buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in
Hong Kong at the date of clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.
10. Claims
i.
Any medical report as reasonably required by the Company shall be
furnished at the expense of the Insured. The Company shall have the
right to medically examine any Insured Person in respect of the submitted
claim and shall also have the right to require an autopsy in case of the
death of any Insured Person where it is not forbidden by law.
ii.
Any claim payments made in any circumstances for which this Policy
does not provide shall in all cases be at the Company's sole discretion.
iii.
If any claim made shall be found to be fraudulent or exaggerated, the
Company shall have the right to terminate this Policy and the Insured
and the Insured Person shall repay to the Company all indemnity and
benefits paid by the Company in respect of such fraudulent or exaggerated
claims. The Company shall have the right to recover from the Insured
and the Insured Person any costs in relation to such termination and
such fraudulent or exaggerated claims.
iv.
Any claim payments will be made to the bank account as designated
by the Insured at the time of application of this policy, or by a cheque
payable to the Insured should the bank account not be designated at
the time of such application.
V.
The Insured must report to the Company in writing in case of the loss
of a daims cheque. A handling fee of HK$100 shall be charged for each
cheque reissuance.
vi.
No reimbursement of claims shall be made for claim(s) submitted after
ninety (90) days from the date of the expenditure being incurred or
insufficiency of required information.
11. Jurisdiction
The Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
Hong Kong courts.
12. Assignment
This Policy shall not be assignable and payment of any indemnity and benefits
by the Company under this Policy shall only be made to the Insured or his/
her legal personal representatives whose receipt of such indemnity and
benefits from the Company via cheque or by autopay through the Insured's
nominated bank account number for claim reimbursement, shall be a full
discharge of the Company's obligation towards the Insured and the Insured
Person in respect of such claim.
13. Arbitration
All differences, disputes or claims arising out of this Policy shall be referred
to the decision of an arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the parties in
difference or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator, to the decision
of two arbitrators one to be appointed by each of the parties in writing or,
in case the arbitrators do not agree with each other an umpire appointed
by the arbitrators in writing will make a decision. The making of the award
shall be a condition precedent to any liability of the Company or any right of
action against the Company in respect of any claim. The seat of arbitration
shall be in Hong Kong.
14. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under
the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of
Hong Kong) to enforce any terms of this Policy.
15. Prevailing Provision
The terms and conditions of this Insurance are set out in both English and
Chinese. In the event that conflicts or inconsistence arise between the English
and Chinese versions, the English version shall prevail.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.
